concise_definition: v. 完成, 结束, 使完整

definitions.explanation_en: To finish or bring to an end something that has been started, especially by fulfilling all required parts or steps.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指完成某件已开始的事物，通过履行所有必要的部分或步骤使其结束。
definitions.example_en: She is completing her degree in environmental science this spring.
definitions.example_cn: 她今年春天将完成环境科学专业的学业。

definitions.explanation_en: To make something whole or perfect by adding the missing elements or final touches.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过添加缺失的元素或最后的修饰，使某物变得完整或完美。
definitions.example_en: The final brushstroke was completing the masterpiece.
definitions.example_cn: 最后一笔为这幅杰作画上了圆满的句号。

definitions.explanation_en: To fulfill an obligation, task, or promise, often implying a sense of responsibility or closure.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指履行一项义务、任务或承诺，常带有责任感或达成终结的意味。
definitions.example_en: He completed his military service with honor.

comparison.analysis: “Finishing” (完成) 更侧重于动作的最后阶段，强调“收尾”或“结束操作”，常用于物理或程序性任务的末端，如“ finishing a painting”（画完一幅画）。“Completing” 则更强调整体目标的达成，包含过程的完整性与责任的履行，语义范围更广。
“Accomplishing” (达成) 强调成功实现一个具有挑战性或目标导向的任务，常带有成就感或克服困难的含义，如“accomplishing a goal”。而 “completing” 更中性，仅表示按计划结束某事，不一定涉及难度或成就。
“Fulfilling” (履行/实现) 常用于抽象义务、承诺或期望，如“fulfilling a duty”或“fulfilling a dream”，强调满足内在或外在的期待。“Completing” 更关注任务的结构性结束，而非价值或情感层面的实现。
